bibl.title: Letter from H. McG. Robertson to Henry Rose Carter, April 18, 1923

div1.p: Robertson sends Carter a copy of his report on bubonic plague and asks for criticism.

div1.head: Letter from H. McG. Robertson to Henry Rose Carter, April 18, 1923
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
1110 Capitol St.,
Richmond Va.
April 18, 1923
Assistant Surgeon General
Henry R. Carter
Washington D. C.
My dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am Enclosing
copy of my article on Bubonic
Plague. The first six pages you
have seen before, there having
been made only a few corrections.

I have tried to make the tables,
and the discussion following
them, a part of the article
tho I am afraid the two parts
do not fit together as well as they
might. I feel sure you will
find, on looking over the last
part of the article, that I
have not covered the ground
fully in my discussion and
I will be glad to have any
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
suggestion and Criticisms
that you may offer when you
have time to look it over.

I am going to submit it to the
Bureau with the request that
it be published, omitting the con-
clusions given in Memorandum
on last page. I think they will
publish it with a statement
that the service will at once
begin investigations as to its
bearing on conditions in the
United States.

I enjoyed So much my little
visit with you and Miss Laura,
and I trust that both of you
continue well. With Kindest
regards for you both, I am,
div1.closer: Very Sincerely yours, H. McG. Robertson.
